intro: Faramea fallax, commonly known as the False Broom. It is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. Faramea fallax is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
